revised_title: The Seed-Fungus of Lolium Temulentum and its Relationship to Darnel Toxicity
tldr: The author investigates the seed-fungus of Lolium temulentum, the darnel, and its relationship to the plant's toxicity. The fungus is found to be present in a specific layer of the seed and is suggested to be a case of symbiosis rather than true parasitism. The author also discusses the challenges in growing the fungus outside its host-plant and determining its systematic position within the fungal kingdom.
